On Tue, 3 Sep 2002, Niall James O'Higgins wrote:

> On Tue, Sep 03, 2002 at 07:07:34PM -0000, dph_of_rules wrote:
> > Actually, it wouldn't be that hard if you know how to write
> > information to a scenario file.  Most of it would be about processing
> > commands which is really easy to do.

The scenario file format is described excessively in screen.cpp (I think
that's the right file) in the source code. I think you already
reverse-engeneered it, but if there's anything you're not sure of, its
probably described in there. The format of the .001 files is also
somewhere in the source (or if not, you can see it by looking through
utils/gladpack.c)

> Terrain generation, item placement, enemy placement - all this isnt
> easy to do! Not if you want nice, convincing levels anyways.

True. Random things scattered everywhere don't look nice.

Anyways, this sounds like a very interesting project. I'll be glad to
help out whenever it gets underway.


- Zardus
